Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, one on land (e.g., garden, forest) and one in water (e.g., pond, stream).
The student can observe and illustrate different types of living things in each habitat such as plants (e.g., trees, grasses, flowering plants) and animals (e.g., lizards, squirrels, fish).
The student can depict and label the diversity of plant and animal life in each habitat, showing the differences and similarities between them.
The student can demonstrate patterns of biodiversity by comparing the different types of living things across the two habitats.
The student can organize and label observations clearly to show evidence of plant and animal diversity within the drawn habitats.
